posts.content:
Marketing isn't about selling. It's about connecting.

The best products don't need aggressive sales tactics. They solve real problems for real people.
posts.quiz_question: Which line best reflects the idea in this post?

quiz_options.label: A
quiz_options.text: Marketing is about persuasion through discounts.

quiz_options.label: B
quiz_options.text: Marketing starts with solving a real customer pain.

quiz_options.label: C
quiz_options.text: Marketing works only with large budgets.

posts.quiz_explanation: The post emphasizes solving real customer problems before pitching.

posts.content:
Rule #1: Never lose money.
Rule #2: Never forget Rule #1.

Compounding is the 8th wonder of the world.
posts.quiz_explanation: Consistent contributions over time let compound growth do the heavy lifting.

practice_questions.question: What is the benefit of the 3-second pause before answering?

options.label: A
options.text: It helps you sound more confident and organized.

practice_questions.explanation: A short pause reduces filler words and lets you organize your response.

practice_questions.title: Swipe Practice · UX Basics
practice_questions.question: Which principle best matches 'good design is invisible'?

options.label: A
options.text: Focus on user goals before visuals.

options.label: B
options.text: Add more UI decoration for engagement.

options.label: C
options.text: Use every feature to show capability.

practice_questions.explanation: If users reach their goals effortlessly, the design stays out of the way.
